Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sunnycrockett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice and was perfect. Very clean friendly the staff were brilliant and great location for what we wanted. Never had a meal in hotel though but it looked nice. Lovely coffee shop round the corner and Thai as well. We will be going back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Glen1969
Reviews.Content: One our first trip to Berlin, we booked into the Berlin Excelsior which is in Charlottenberg and about a 10 minute stroll from Zoo Station or "Zoologischer Garten" as they say in Germany. The hotel staff are exceeding warm, friendly and efficient. The rooms are large and spacious with all modern conveniences catered for. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I have seen with just about every breakfast food on the menu on display. My only critism is that smoking is permitted in the lobby and as a non-smoker this is a little off-putting. However, it didn't detract from the enjoyment of my stay and would whole heartedly recommend the Excelsior if you are considering a trip to the fabulous city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vincent H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything is good from the rooms to the hotel services. It is pretty near the train station and the main shopping belt at ku'damn, just a slow ten minutes stroll away or 5 mins if you are on paced steps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic location, rooms a little on the small side”
Reviews.Author: N B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as 3 guys on a weekend trip to Berlin in January 2012. Location of the hotel was excellent, a stone's throw away from Berlin Zoo and its associated train station and one of the main shopping districts "Kurfürstendamm." The lobby and bar of the hotel were both very modern and clean, bar was excellent if a little pricey compared to elsewhere. Rooms were a little on the small side but were very clean and most importantly warm considering it was -12 outside at the time. Would definitely recommend others staying here if they were in Berlin for a few days and planned to spend most of their time out and about and not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, Nice breakfeast, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kuglen04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 couples 8 people, on a weekend Tour. The location was excellent, the rooms was dissapointingly small. They looks much more Big on the pictures on the internet, but be prepared for very small boxes. A clean hotel, friendly staff, many of the staff spoke german, Danish, swedish and english- surprised. Very Nice breakfeast, many to choose from. Close to KaDeWe, perfect for shopping. Happy that we didn't had to stay in this room for more than 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: kath91982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011 with my sister and her boyfriend. I have been to Berlin several times and this was my second time staying around the zoo. Berlin has no real "center" of town, and its so big and spread out that there are many areas that would be good to stay in . I enjoyed this location as it is close to the shopping district and the Zoo train stop can get you anywhere by bus or train. The rooms were large and bathrooms were decent. The location is about 2 blocks from the zoo. I think next time I would stay on the other side of the zoo a bit closer to the kdamm, but other than that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Ozgur_Ucman
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for an exhibition at Messe and stayed at this hotel for the second time. Hotel is in close proximity to the exhibition hall. It is located in the Ku'damm area (which is actually a shopping area). I made an advance booking and got a good rate although it was a exhibition period. My colleagues were charged almost double. Friendly staff, modern hotel. Rooms are spacious when compared to similar hotels. It is advertised that WiFi is complimentary at the hotel. Yes it is but only for 30 minutes. They charge you 12,50 Euros for a 24 hours connection. Breakfast is satisfactory. Buffet is not unlimited but enough. This is a good spot to stay for business travellers. Yet it is not proximite to touristical sights. For leisure travellers, I would recommend to stay in Mitte area which is the bohemian district of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but rooms not very clean”
Reviews.Author: ossama e
Reviews.Content: hotel reciptian is good and helpfull, breakfast is good, rooms small and not very clean as you can not walk in the rooms without shos, we have asked for iron but we told we do not give iron and in the next day we find the house keeper carying one to next room, they only change the beds but the cleaning is poor in the rooms and beds are too small frank resturant is good and they have a good food the rate is 6 out of 10 O el´sherif London

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nipekim
Reviews.Content: I am a resident of Asia and I don't understand why we as a community of consumers put up with the horrendous service, terrible room amenities and inconsistency that make your eyes water in Europe! The cost is usually 3 times the amount and upon arrival you have to carry your own luggage, open your own doors, smile to yourself and be amused at the room the size of a 10 cent piece!!!!!! Once in room you are faced with an additional charge of 10 Euro a day for internet!!!! Hmm shocking but true, but the real shock is - that is valid for 1 unit per time. Each time I am on the computer and want to use the phone I have to log off one and log on the other. Is this 2012? Again, come on consumer just say NO and don't stay here! Maybe then these companies will realize they have to make an effort for guest to stay instead of doing the bear minimum. On my 3rd night, my room was made up with 1 towel! No hand towel, no bathmat nothing! Called Reception and after 10 minutes finally answered by a rude receptionist asking for room number over and over again. When I asked him his name he said Sami and it busy so get on with it! Why do we put up with this? I am amazed! Overall there MUST be better in Berlin and if not, come on consumer get together and STOP putting up with these rubbish hotels for such enormous price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our family city break”
Reviews.Author: welshig
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (adults and teenagers) spent 4 comfortable nights at the Excelsior on our first visit to Berlin and all enjoyed it. Welcoming and helpful staff throughout our stay, smallish bedrooms but ideal for a city break, very clean city hotel with a cosy/warm feel to it but at same time light and modern. Loved the open fire in the reception/bar area gave cosy feel to it. The Hotel was quiet (no traffic noise) even though on a main street and we found a variety of restaurants and good shopping streets nearby, also very handy for the Zoo and public transport/train station which are 2-3 mins walk away. We will gladly stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomtdn
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a hotel that has clearly been rehabbed. if you want a quaint old world feeling..you won't find it here. Sleek and glossy, the hotel has the feel of a modern city hotel. Reflective surfaces in the rooms. large oversized photography that also reflects back at you...white linens, wall mounted flat screen tv...you get the idea. The room is small, but well designed. My 23 year old son loved the decor and atmosphere. I prefer a little less sheen and alittle more warmth in my decor. The staff was extremly helpful. The hotel is a 15 minute ride from Tega and ahalf block from the metro. The price was great. I was ony there for a night so I didn't avail myself of amenities like the spa or restaurant. I was a little surprised that they charged for the wi-fi...I definitely would stay again , despite my liking older hotels with more warm atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a City Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sparenberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location just out of the city centre with Public transport 5 min walk away. the neighbourhood is cool with good restaurants. The hotel it self is ok but not that great, check-in went smooth and "basic" given info was ok. The room was nice with everything you need. nice size and ideal for a City trip. the Ritueals ammenities are a cool. we had a room on the inside on the top floor. Internet is for free for 30min. per day. Breakfast was a nice attraction. maby we had some bad luck but it was busy but ok. but the staff made it hilarious for me and my partner to watch. no plates because the dishwasser was "smoking"? no seating what resluts in chaos finding a place. first day workers on a saterday morning with a full house is not that great either to so I had to clean my one table what results in angry staff because I was not allowed. nevertheless I was pleased to help and I'm making fun of this because I do work in a Hotel aswell and worked in all departments incl. breakfast but other guest where not that amused. NOTE: the food placed on the breakfastbuffet was nsuperb and everything was there and enough. the chefs worked hard to provide everybody with what the wanted, great service on that one. concluding, the hotel is beautiful, with a prefect location for a city trip. when visting Berlin you are outside and not staying all day in a hotel. despide the breakfast "chaos" I can kind off recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great and inexpensive base for a fantastic city stay”
Reviews.Author: paula_reid
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotels.com at the end of last year and got a great rate, so we think we got a real bargain. We got back from our trip this afternoon and had a fantastic time. Other than the obvious attractions of Berlin as a destination (just not enough time to do everything so we're already planning a return visit!), this hotel was a perfect base for us to explore the city. We travelled as a couple and spent most of the day out and about, so all we needed was a reasonably-sized room, a comfortable bed and good bathroom facilities. I can't comment on facilities for families, the quality of the food other than breakfast, or how problems are handled, as we have no experience of these things. The hotel is very well situated near the zoo and a number of U-bahn, train and bus services. Most of the city is walkable from the hotel if you want, but bring good comfy shoes! There is also some great shopping and eating in the neighbourhood, which is quite a buzzy and cosmopolitan one. The positives: the welcome and the general standard of service, from the Reception Desk and elsewhere, was warm and professional. They were happy to provide advice or recommendations, and when our room was a little too warm on the first night (cold winter equals all radiators on full blast, and ours had no obvious on/off switch) all we had to do was ask and they sent someone up to fix the problem. Similarly, when we used the free PCs to check in for our return flight the receptionist copied our boarding cards on a data stick and printed them out for us- a lovely touch. The Reception, Restaurant area and Bar are all beautifully appointed, and the public toilets in the basement are spotless. Service in all areas is polite, friendly and unintrusive. The rooms are nice- not the biggest or the most luxurious in the world but clean, smart and more than adequate for a city break where the point is not to spend all your time in the hotel. And they are pretty well appointed, with really comfy beds and plenty of storage options. The bathroom is also well-equipped and the shower is pretty powerful without flooding the whole room, which is often a problem with over-bath showers. Breakfast was also really nice- a huge choice of food and you can go back and refill your plate as many times as you want, so you can really stock up ahead of a hard day's walking. The not so good bits? There is currently renovation work going on in the building next door, and the noise from that would be pretty intrusive if you wanted to rest or sleep during the day. No idea how long this work is scheduled to go on for, but if the noise might be a problem for you, you might want to ask before booking. Additionally (and this might just be our room but then again maybe not), the bathroom door wasn't a great fit and you had to give it a real 'heave' to get it closed. The door handle is so close to the door frame that when you pull it closed, you invariably take all the skin off your knuckles! A small detail but easy to fix- change the door handles and shave a bit off the door, and presto, no more niggles. The minibar was pricey and a bit shabby, and the safe required a key to lock it, which may or may not have been available from Reception, but like a lot of stuff in our room it came with no instructions- a bit of an oversight which meant we didn't get the most from the TV, safe, air conditioning, and couldn't even switch off our own heater. Breakfast, although nice, was not included in our room rate and was also quite expensive. Make sure you're hungry if you want to take it, so you get your money's worth. Or do what the chap sitting opposite us did, and use the bread, ham and cheese to make a load of sandwiches and smuggle them out in his briefcase, presumably to save money on his lunch. In summary? Yes, we'd definitely book this hotel again. It's nice, offers good value for money, and is in a very good location with great facilities nearby and good transport links. Other than a couple of tiny details, we couldn't really find any fault and would certainly recommend it. It feels like a place which is certainly 'on the up' and I'm sure those little niggles will be straightened out in time. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. The restaurant on the expensive side, but there is plenty of places at walking distance. Transportation to anywhere close by (train and buses). Would definitely return. The hotel is well managed,comfortable and very good service

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is located close to the station Zoo”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: I came to Berlin on business for a few days, every time I try to choose another hotel, this time I chose this one. The hotel is located close to the station Zoo. I do not know the brand of hotels and do not know if this is a hotel network, but in truth there was cozy and the room was well equipped. The combination of a mile and communicative service and daily room cleaning a whole to come to this hotel I think it is very successful. Internet here is free, what's important.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AmySL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay in the Excelsior. The hotel was very modern and clean in appearance. The staff were friendly at all times and helpful when looking for sightseeing information. The location was great less than 5 minutes walk from the train station which got us all around Berlin and direct to the airport. The bedroom was nice and clean just slightly dated. We didn't like the 2 single beds together used as a double bed. Wifi was free in the reception for 30 minutes per day per room which was useful. Overall good hotel would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: STARKEY
Reviews.Content: The location of the Excelsior is excellent just a short walk from Zoo station.There are also a number of good restaurants close by. Check-in was fine and we did not have to queue for check-out as we had paid in advance.The room was o k but not 4 star.We had no tea or coffee facilities and a small bottle of water in the room was 3 euros so we bought our own at the excellent market beside the station(and wine!) The room was clean and quiet as it was at the back of the hotel and towels were replaced each day. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast and everything was always topped up which was good it being such a busy restaurant.The rates for the Excelsior vary greatly so look around for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, terrible attitude. NOT a 4 * hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MagadogFinland
Reviews.Content: In general, I've never been so disappointed with a hotel. With everything from the booking to the reseption to the rooms to the service; all was BAD. I've been to almost 40 countries, and three times to Berlin, and this hotel is about the worst of all, due to the attitude they have. First of all, it was impossible to get an answer to my emails from the hotel. We had bought vouchers from Groupon, and I emailed all the addressess found for the hotel. Then I emailed the representatives of the hotel's chain. No answer, to any of my emails regarding a reservation enquiry. And I emailed at least 10 times. Well, as there was no other way to get contact, as I couldn't get through by phone either, I asked from Groupon, and they said that the hotel had had some problems with their emails, but everything should be fine now. Ok, so I emailed yet again. No answer. Furstrated, I made the reservation through booking.com, writing into the booking about the problems with their emails, and after that I also emailed the hotel directly about having to have reserved through booking.com as they did not respond to anything. Guess what? No answer. I was quite worried, but as I'd been to Berlin twice before I knew I'd find a hotel in case the Excelsior would not provide us with the rooms. Well, when arriving at the hotel, we received our rooms and the receptionist did not comment anything when I explained our problems. Ok, so all was well we throught. We had reserved one superior and one standard double, and asked if we could have two superiors (I had emailed about that too..) as we travelled as two couples, the other with two under 2 year olds. The receotionist said they had upgraded the family into a superior as well, due to the babycot. Well, when we went into the rooms, our rooms was not a superior, as there was barely enough room to walk around the bed. Really tiny, Italian size room, which we did not expect. We went to see the familyroom, and that indeed was a bit bigger. So it seemed that we had got a standard nevermind what the receptionist said. Too tired to complain, we settled with that. The next morning the couple with the family went for an early breakfast, which was included in our vouchers. The receptionist (a man, different from the night before), said that our bookings do not include breakfast, and that they should pay 18 euros per person for it. Our friends tried to explain that it was included in the voucher, and the man lost his temper and started demanding that we have to PAY for the first night because we did the booking the wrong way. And he did not let my friends and their kids to go to breakfast before they had paid! At this point my friends came to wake me up, I took all my papers with me and went to talk with the man. He insisted that the whole thing was OUR fault, and that we had to pay for the first night, then cancel our booking at booking.com and then we could stay with the vouchers. I explained again about the connection problems, and he just shook his head and said there were no troubles, never had been, and smiled! That clearly we had not booked properly, and all of this was just our problem and we had to pay. I started to get really angry as he treated us like criminals, and insisted that he ask the manager or someone else to come, as he was not willing to even listen to us, let alone try to solve the problem. Finally after reluctantly speaking on the phone with someone he said that we had to prove that we had emailed them, and so I went to one of the computers in the lobby to print out my emails to them. After seeing them the guy finally called someone, and then reluctantly said that "ok, this is now ok." No apology, not even a "sorry", just "you can now have breakfast". And then he went on to the next guest at the counter like nothing had happened. I was so angry I couldn't believe this was supposed to be a four star hotel!!! Other downsides; - the cups and plates at the breakfast always run out, there were never enough. - At the first breakfast we we were asked coffee or tea, took coffee, and then saw that other people around us were having cappucinos and lattes, which we were not offered. Oh well, decided to ask for that the next morning. However, when we did that, the waitress said that the coffee machine was broken, and it remained broken for the rest of our stay. - Our friends asked for more towels on the first day, as they had the two kids, but despite asking again and again, they had to manage the whole stay with 4 people and two towels. - Our vouchers included late check out, but the receptionist (yet another different person) just said "we're fully booked, that is not possible"! - Then, when we were leaving for the airport they called us a cab (needed a bigger one with the kids), and said it would come at 18.00. At 17.50 a big cab came to the front of the hotel, but we were packing the kids etc. in the lobby, and assumed that the cabby or the receptionist would come to tell us if it was ours, as we were right in front of the counter, and the girl at the reception had asked where we'd be waiting. We went on packing our stuff and went to the bathroom, and at a few minutes past six I looked and saw the cab still there. I asked the reception and the girl just said "oh yes that's yours". Pardon my french but WTF kind of service is this?!?! - Also, the bathrooms downstairs of the restaurant were apaulling; literally there was actual brown materia around the floors on two different occasions when I went there. In different stalls. - When we were checking out, we had the rooms till 12.00. At 10.30 the maid started to knock and ask if she could clean, we refused. A moment later, when we went to our friends room down the hall, she came again. Then she went to harass our friends again, about the same issue. She went on to peek into the rooms everytime we moved our stuff or otherwise opened the door. - the rooms were worn, the design was ok but it could be seen that it had been a while since any renovations. E.g. our mirror was cracked. The one and only nice thing I have to say about this "hotel" is that the lobby downstairs is designed nicely. That's it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: Flyaway9699
Reviews.Content: This is a fine value for the money. The room was clean and moderately quiet (at the back of the building), the bed comfortable, and the coffee machine and kettle appreciated. The staff was helpful enough but certainly not the calibre of other hotels I have stayed. There is no concierge and the restaurant recommendation they gave was clearly a stop on the large and over 65 bus tours. My first impression was that it was an old, American Howard Johnson's. (we did not eat there). It was inexpensive though and close to a lot of public transportation. They seem to be renovation if not a wing of the hotel then an attached building however so if you plan to be in your room after 9am expect some jack hammering.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Nick1990_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Myself and my friend stayed here for a long weekend. The staff were excellent, as was the service. The food and drink was well priced for a 4* Hotel too. The rooms are a tad on the small side but this is not a disadvantage. Everywhere was clean and well apointed.

Reviews.Title: “decent weekend stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matman73
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed there for a long weekend, the service was great and the staff friendly, no faults there, the room was pretty small, but fortunately we were not in the room long enough as we were out exploring Berlin, The hotel is very close to the main station and underground (5 min walk), making travel around Berlin very easy. Turn right as you come out the hotel and take the first right and walk 5 min and your on the main shopping street and their are loads of restaurants, Hard Rock cafe, shops, the sight seeing bus leaves from there to, so you can get everything you want there and not have to eat at the hotel which was pretty expensive. The hotel is in a great location for getting to trains, shops and restaurants. We had a great long weekend in Berlin, hope you do do.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Yuhkura2011dezember
Reviews.Content: very good location. but television was poor. maybe i will stay next time at berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Company event hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan D
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a company event. The hotel is well located in Berlin, close to shopping district and cultural spots. Rooms are ok but not more, the standard rooms are small so if you want to have the travel case on the floor dont book the standard room. Breakfast is very good but the buffe lunch and dinner have a potential to be better....

Reviews.Title: “OVERBOOKED - If you want a good break DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Wizzaworld
Reviews.Content: We arrived back today. Would not recommend this hotel. I am still very angry about this hotel. Basically with toddler in tow and not a great flight we arrive on a cold winter evening. Our toddler had just got to sleep and had managed to acquire a cough from somewhere. So we arrive at reception to be told that the hotel is overbooked. Do not understand as we booked through hotels.com and have never had a problem before? Anyway they said they would send us to another 5 star hotel a short distance away for the first night. (couldn't care if it was a 7 star!) ALL WE WANTED WAS A ROOM TO PUT OUR TIRED BABY INTO WE HAD A CONFIRMED RESERVATION, WE HADNT JUST WALKED IN FROM THE STREET. So whatever they offered me had basically spoilt the first day of our city break (packing and unpacking is a nuisance). We came back second day as we were staying 4 nights as we didn't really have a choice and we were not going to pay again. Got back in the room to find a fruit plate in cellophane, but it really was the principle I would rather they got it right the first time than sent a cheap fruit plate to the room. I think this happens quite a lot being overbooked as the hotel we went to seemed to act like this was a regular occurrence, we met lots of other people who were unhappy too. All fur coat and no knickers for sure! Rooms small, very noisy! Lots of bits broken in rooms, lots of other lovely hotels in Berlin. Also if you know that it was going to be overbooked maybe send out an email in advance, it is 2011 you know! be interesting to see a management response on this one, don't trust anything they say now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good value 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelupdate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an enjoyable 4 night stay at the Excelsior. The hotel is conveniently located on Hardenbergstrasse, in the west of the city. It is close to the main shopping street, Kurfurstendamm ( also known as Ku’Damm). We had a comfortable room (515) which was spacious, clean and nicely furnished. We booked the break through ‘Trailfinders’ and the price included a good buffet breakfast with plenty of choice. From check-in through to check-out all the staff we met were pleasant, courteous, helpful and efficient. Three new Apple computers are available in the lobby for use by hotel guests, free of charge. There is also decent sized gym and a small library in the lobby. In summary the Excelsior is a very good place to stay either for business or pleasure. Tips – getting to the Excelsior from Tegel international airport is easy. There is an excellent airport bus service, the X9. It takes around 20/25 mins from Tegel to the Zoologischer Garten bahnhof (cost 2.30 euro single). From the railway station it is only a short walk of around 300 metres to the hotel in Hardenbergstrasse. The Berlin Welcome card is good value. Cost 24.90 euro for 72 hours card gives unlimited travel by bus, train and U bahn. The card also gives discounts on entrance fees for tourist attractions. Recommend the bus route number100 which leaves from the Zoologischer Garten taking you past many of the Berlin landmarks to Alexanderplatz. Berlin has many excellent shops. Would recommend a visit to the KaDeWe department store on Tauentzienstrasse (only a 15 minute walk from the Excelsior). It’s a shoppers delight. Good food at reasonable prices in Le Buffet restaurant on the top floor of the store. Reichstag – If you want to visit then make sure you book in advance. Online registration is available so think about booking before you travel to Berlin. We were not aware of this so missed out. A visit Potsdam is recommended. It’s a lovely city with many places of historical interest. The journey by S-Bahn train from the Zoologischer Gardens bahnhof takes around 30 minutes and the price of the rail ticket was included in the Berlin Welcome card. It’s well worth doing the city and palace tour which starts and finishes at the Potsdam bahnhof. The 2.5 hour tour we took cost 20 euro but there is a 25% reduction with a Welcome Card.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette B
Reviews.Content: We had a perfectly lovely time at this hotel....all was good...apart from the beds on wheels!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: adereth
Reviews.Content: Good location, a short walk from some good shopping, and not far from a subway station. Very nice breakfast. Rooms are clean and cosy. Service is not brilliant, but not too bad

Reviews.Title: “Very Good..”
Reviews.Author: Aous1985
Reviews.Content: Good service, cosy environment, and excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “A proper breakfast & excellent location, neat! Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Eljas21
Reviews.Content: Good choice for a 2 night stay. I agree with others who have made a bit negative feedback on the lack of free wifi, though. Additionally the info board on the hotel TV promises internet service, but does not say anything that it is for cable connection, only. The Finns seldom carry cables when travelling. We expect cordless. That was the ONLY minus, other things being on excellent level. Also reception service, despite the fact that they did not suggest not to compensate the price of internet service paid for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend it”
Reviews.Author: kbpdk
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated rooms, very good service at the counter, nice bathroom, nice breakfast, good location. The bed was also comfortable, giving me a good night's sleep. One drawback: when I got up in the early morning, there was a strange constant noise making me think that the room next door was housing a washing machine. It didn't bother me much, but my colleague who had stayed in the room below had experienced quite loud and annoying noises, maybe coming from the radiator and ruining his sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Berlin with Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: DK-Desi
Reviews.Content: Very nice and elegant hotel. We arrived late evening and was recieved by mr. Shabaz at the reception. Got excellent service from him. No problems with check-in, he cleared all our doubts, answered the questions and was helpful in every way. The rooms are ok, not that big, but just ok in size. We had breakfast included in our room-rate. The breakfast is located at Franke. We loved the breakfast, very good choice and quality. They had different kinds of bread, jams, cheese, hot and cold buffet, juices (not fres made) and you could order any type of egg-dish. The staff was attentative and did whatever possible to provided what we asked for. The location of the hotel is excellent, in very close proximity of Zoologischer Garten railway station. Very close to the shopping area, Cafe and restaurant. As we arrived late in Berlin I did not bother to use the train. I prebooked taxi from Schonefeld airport throught taxi2airport. They were friendly and serviceoriented. It cost 47 euro one way. Overall very very good value of money.

Reviews.Title: “Some positive, some negative”
Reviews.Author: jonathang
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed for 2 nights at the Excelsior and there are definite positives and negatives about this hotel. To get the negatives out of the way, the air-con in room 722 was ineffectual - it made a lot of noise but didn't cool down the room. When we asked to move room the next day we weren't given the option at Reception - however we found that you could actually open the window so the temperature was OK the second night. The rooms are small and pretty clean (although not perfect) as is the bathroom. The public areas are lovely looking and the breakfast was pretty good. The location of this hotel makes it worth it - there are many high end shops and restaurants nearby (we stronly recommend Juleps Bar And Restaurant), and its very close to the zoological garden railway station. Overall- we'd stay again but in a room with working air-con.

Reviews.Title: “My review”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location. Across the road from Berlin Zoo which has a number of different transport links. It is also very close to the main shopping area and has great access to a number of different restaurants. The hotel itself is very nice. modern and clean with nice little areas to socialise and relax. The rooms are basic but clean. They could really do with being updated/freshened up but I'm not sure if that was just our room or all of them. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend to anyone who is taking a short trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Th reception staff was on the good side”
Reviews.Author: Krn2011
Reviews.Content: I may agree with previous reviewers who wrote about the small rooms and dated furniture as well as being a little bit out of the city center. For being honest we did not ask for that hotel, but it was replaced in the last minute by our agent (already a former agent!). While there was something that helped us not to fall down with that trip at all.. We invited a room for 2 adults + child. On our arrival to the hotel we found that we should get the room for 2 that does not allow an additional bed insert. The reception staff showed me the reservation for 2 only! It was late August and the hotel was full of tourists. After some discussion, we were treated by Mrs. Honegan (sorry for possible name misspelling) from the reception. She found for us the reserve suite (2 rooms), and even cared to change it on the next day when we claimed that we need a non-smoking room. That's an attitude!

Reviews.Title: “I want free wifi!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lois B
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, lovely bar area with fireplace and library, but it is so frustrating not to have free internet access. It should be available 24/7 during my entire stay, not just for 30 minutes. McDonaldäs and Starbucks can do it, why not the Excelsior?

Reviews.Title: “i love berlin !”
Reviews.Author: ju p
Reviews.Content: i love berlin ! riding the city by bik7e is the best do not miss the judaism museum

Reviews.Title: “Our Trip To Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: Me (21) and my boyfriend (23) booked a 3 night stay in the Excelsior Hotel, Berlin, I will make all my comments very brief. Hotel is lovely and so are the bar and restaurant! very glam with a beautiful fire place! The rooms are good, although I do think if they never had a fancy painting on the wall along with nice bed sheets it would be a bit dull and dreary!! The service has been good although we havent required much help! Definately take a travel iron as they dont have any in the hotel but they do offer an ironing service at a cost! We travelled to Alexandraplatz by bus (bus no. 100) which was so simple and straight forward, there didnt seem a great deal there unless sightseeing and museums are really your thing! The best area I think is near the Europa Center (Big Mercedez Sign on top of the building) and kurfuerstendamm (Kudam) the shops are really good and there are so many places to eat! P.S no shops are open on a Sunday!!! oh and the Zoo is the best ive ever been to in my life!! so make sure you definitley make a trip there, maybe on a Sunday when no where is open just like what we did! also the computer has 4 huge apple mac computers to use at your leisure which comes in very handy

Reviews.Title: “Rooms,Internet,Reception....”
Reviews.Author: pam88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with husband & three teenagers - booked 2 rooms. Our reception desk greeting on arrival unfortunately set the tone for our stay. Middle aged male concierge had a rude & officious manner when checking us in. However, other reception staff were all very helpful & friendly during the rest of our stay. Internet - only one connection per room, charged at 12 Euro day & kept dropping out. We need the internet for business so found this very frustrating. Rooms: dated, too small for our liking & airconditioning not working very well . Cleaning was of a good standard. Breakfasts excellent . Ground floor reception area looks good - modern & stylish with a bar, restaurant & lounge area. Location excellent for train & Tegal airport as described by other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location nice room”
Reviews.Author: sandra101London
Reviews.Content: Just had 4 nights stay at this hotel which I found on expedia and was very pleased as the location was just as described. 5 minutes walk to Zoologischer garten (bus,train station) which will get you all over Berlin. You can buy a days adult ticket in the station for 6.30euros each and this covers zone A&B and is unlimited travel on S & U bahn trains and all buses for the day of purchase and until 3am the next day. Very good value. Just hop on and off.We took Bus 100 from here and it stopped at the reichstag, walk round corner to see Brandenburg gate, back on bus to Alexanderplatz for the TV Tower and the got the Bus 200 back via Potsdam Platz. If you plan to go to the Reichstag you must pre-register online at least 3 days in advance otherwise you can not get in. Log onto www.bundestag.de/anfrageformulare and leave first name, surname and date of birth for each person wishing to go on. Good luck. Our hotel was good and room at quite small but adequate and very well equipped. Buffet breakfast advertised as 18 euros each but if you book with reception in advance the day before you get it for 12 euros each and there is a lot to offer, so well worth it. Berlin is a great place and we would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gezza48
Reviews.Content: Booked through Groupon by calling the hotel directly. Excellent hotel. Good breakfast. Near to zoo train station. Train from airport only 3 Euros

Reviews.Title: “god+”
Reviews.Author: monica k
Reviews.Content: iokt was a all over nice hotel. Room cleaning could+ be better. Quiet and l

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: 189934Kap64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights with my teenager. Excellent location, excellent breakfast and very helpful staff. The room could have been more cleaner but the bathtube was a nice surprise and we slept very well in a room in the 6th floor. Easy and fast access from Tegel airport with bus X9.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: cortneyr
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was pretty nice. I was a little weary only paying $107/ night but when we arrived I was very pleased. The lobby is quite nice and the rooms are nice as well. The bathrooms were pretty small but it wasn't a big deal. The rooms were small as well, but that's typically European hotel rooms. As long as your not going to Berlin to just sit in your room the whole trip, this is a great place and for the price, you can't beat it. It's within walking distance to shopping and the zoo. You can pay for internet in your room but there was free internet access in the main lobby so I would just use the computers for free. The internet was pretty fast there as well. There's a bar and a restaurant in the hotel but we didn't go to either of those places so I can't give any feedback about those. We did take a walking tour that starts in front of McDonald's next to the zoo station. It's 12 euros/person and lasts 4 hours. The one we took was called the famous walking tour and I would definitely recommend it. The guide was nice and very informative. We saw the Brandenburg gate, checkpoint charlie, the wall, the memorial of the book burning, a Jewish memorial and we stood over the place where Hitler's bunker once was. From the zoo (which is about a 5 minute walk away) you can take the bus or train or metro to anywhere you want to go. From the airport you can take the X9 bus to the zoologischer garten stop. The bus costs 2,30 euros a person and once you get off the bus, you walk about 5 minutes back in the direction you just came from. The hotel is on that main street and if you're looking out the right hand side of the bus, you'll see it right before you stop at the zoo. You can also get back on the X9 bus at the zoo to take you back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excelsior, Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MartinKeegan
Reviews.Content: Had a Good room (quiet Room) on the 3rd floor and had all the features in a room you would expect for example Tea, coffee, powdered Milk and a Free Safe to put your valuables in too. The room Maids made my room up everyday that i was there too. The Breakfasts where Very Good from hot food to the Hams & Cheeses too The Reception Staff where also very good and helped me to find a certain Museum that i was interested in going too. The Lounge was very comfortable too and good comfortable Seating too. The only disappointing thing that i found was that the wifi was only Free to Hotel Stayers for half an hour per Day which was Poor. This Hotel is Very Close to Zoo Garten S Bahn & U Bahn Railway Station

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excelsior Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Albert S
Reviews.Content: I like everything about Excelsior Hotel except the bathroom. The bathtub is too high, too narrow and too slippery. As a Senior Citizen, I found it to be very dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Average - Poor all round”
Reviews.Author: senjat
Reviews.Content: Best thing: reasonable location for West Berlin, possibly good for work traveller. Not far from zoo and not far from Tiergarten. Worst thing: that the best thing is the only good thing you can say about it Very poorly organised reception, don't come here on a group booking they cannot cope with the paperwork. Trying to contact reception from room phone was fruitless, the worst I have experienced.Their attitude seems also highly self righteous! No signs for do not disturb. You might think you could be paying so that you can relax in your room but no you will not get let up from disturbance from housekeeping who have no way of being informed of your presence. They could be rather more quiet and respectful though. The pillows are so soft as to become uncomfortable. The effect of the two mattresses / beds being pulled together to form one double is not too problematic. Overlooking a main road in West Berlin does not have much character and is not very quiet. The area is also fairly expensive and blandly capitalist for Berlin - I prefer to stay north east if possible. TV on the wall means easy to hear your neighbour. Bedroom and bathroom do not have a lot of space but are at least functional.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mfreshour
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, we arrived late and was just tired and ready for bed. We were shown our room and dismissed the bell hop. I was just about to fall onto the bed and seen something on the comforte. You guessed it, someone left their private fluids on the comforter. I called the front desk and the night manager and maid came to the room and confirmed what I had thought, they changed the bed. Too late for me though laid there all night wondering about the cleanliness, and what else might be left in there. Left bright and early the next morning was compted, but that doesn't help now.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: As we checked in we were offered a breakfast buffet for euro 12 per person which we accepted and the brakfast was the best of all our hotels in Europe but at check out, our bill showed 18 euros per person, I protested and it was reduced to the 12 euros. The rooms are comfortable but the bathrooms are very tiny, it would work for one person, not for 2. I would rate this hotel a 3 not 4.Location is great, walking distance to train station and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Not excellent Groupon deal for Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKopniarz
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to Berlin Festival and then I found this Groupon offer for hotel in Berlin. Offer was : 3 nights for 2 people with breakfast for about 172 eur. Sound nice, right ? So we went to Berlin. Hotel is rated as 4* but I would rather say only lobby and restaurant is ment as 4*. Rooms are more like 3*. What I mean is I would expect rather bigger room with free internet at least then rather small but modern interior room with only 30min free wifi per 24 hours. Room & bathroom( with bath tube+ shower in one) were clean and bright. AC was working, TV & mini bar was there. Hotel stuff is very nice and helpful. The same I can say about people workimg at the restaurant. There is parking at the hotel - costs 15 eur per day. Hotel is located max 5 min by walk to Zoologicher Garten U - bahn station. Esay acces to Mitte ( downtown) by trains and even when you have to change train its not so complicated. Planning to go to Berlin next time we will defiatelly concider staying at the Excelsior Hotel again. I would just keep my fingers crossed for free wifi there :)

Reviews.Title: “Paying for everything”
Reviews.Author: NICOLAS O
Reviews.Content: 3€ a bottle of water, 15€ to enjoy a tiny fitness room (which is not said in the website), "cleaning" the room consisted in only making the beds, not even cleaning the dirt from the previous guests in the toilet or gathering the goods they left behind. Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olga V
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay and the room were very nicely decorated! Location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! - but that's it”
Reviews.Author: SpicySugar
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Zoologischer Garten which is great. Looks great from the outside and the lobby + restaurant looks promising. But the room is very dated, need to hit the TV like old time so it doesnt flicker. No toileteries like shampoo, lotion, conditioner etc, just a tiny dispenser stuck on the wall with bad-smelling shower gel. Cant borrow iron and board - have to give it to them to do it for you, of course with a charge. Adaptor is available from the front desk, but there is only 1 type which is not usable for an UK visitor. noisy aircond. Only plus point is coffee and tea facilities and hairdryer. Had dinner at the restaurant with 20% as hotel guests and it was not bad. But wont try for breakfast as I am not an early riser.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby but that is where it ends. A bad bad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby but that is where it ends. At least half of rooms are really old and are in a bad condition. We moved several rooms because of in one room shower drainage was blocked and in other rooms there was horrible sewer smell. The breakfast was a disaster, no place to sit, piles of used plates and cups that waiters did not clean up. Several reception staff were aggressive and rude. We will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in berlin”
Reviews.Author: stefan k
Reviews.Content: perfect stay in berlin, the perfect hotel in berlin

Reviews.Title: “A lobby sometimes can deceive you. Its very true in this case.”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: Just by updating a hotel lobby and throwing in a few big screen apple iMac's will do not much to the hotel in a whole. This is a poor hotel with a good location and a nice lobby. The main problem is the size of the rooms. Its half the size of a normal 4 star hotel and the toilet is very small plus it looks old. The breakfast is ok and the internet is also ok. All in all I would avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Citydweller1006
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Excelsior and they could find no record of our booking (through Lastminute.com). We started to panic but the staff, who speak perfect English asked us to take a seat and order a drink. 10-15 minutes later they had done all the checking and calling around and confirmed our booking. They told us to finish our drinks and when we were ready they would check us in. We got up to pay only to be told that as we had to wait there would be no charge for the drinks. Service as you would expect in a German hotel was superb throughout our stay. The rooms are very modern, very clean and come with your own Nespresso coffee maker and complimentary capsules. The bar area is again, very contemporary with lovely bar snacks on offer (try the trio of mini burgers). We were room only but ventured into the restaurant for breakfast. At first I thought it was expensive but when you consider the location, literally a few minutes walk to the centre of Berlin and the standard we realised that it was actually pretty good value. The room was quiet but the train station/shops/sights/restaurants are within a very short distance. We loved this hotel and will definately stay here again if/when we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel, lovely bar, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: abiflo
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel, I am a young woman of 20 and went there in August with my sister. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was lovely but pretty small. Good bathroom. One warning, the breakfast buffet is wonderful BUT be sure to get there early (around 8) because after that it becomes a bit of a free for all with people shoving at each other to get to the food. Also I didn't go to the restaurant but the prices were very very steep somewhere as good value as Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, perfect English”
Reviews.Author: Christineab
Reviews.Content: Great location, right by Zoo station, which is the start of a number of tours, and direct airport link. Extremely helpful and friendly staff, excellent English. Breakfast was excellent, rooms standard, clean and modern. Bathrooms and showers were spotless. My only gripe is there was no iron in the room, but rather an ironing service was available, which to me seemed pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for location, service, comfort and amenity.”
Reviews.Author: Taralulu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for it's location right next to Zoo station from where you can get to the rest of the city and Potsdam quickly and easily. Maybe we were lucky but we each got a double room for 3 nights at only £130 each. I would probably have still been happy if it had cost another£100. Breakfast is not included but hotel offer it for 12euro if you book it at check-in rather than 18euro. It is a good breakfast so well worth it standing the inconvenient alternative of going to a local cafe. Bar a bit pricey and would recommend going to the bar 50 yards to the right.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: GMcC_7
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and quick. We had arrived by train and got to the hotel by 11:00 a.m. Room, not surprisingly, was not ready. We had a seat in the lounge and in twenty minutes had our room. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Bathroom equally so. Room had all the facilities needed. Breakfast was very ample and pleasant. We also had dinner twice which was excellent. Food for dinner was not German but very good international. I had superb duck and prawns. The location is excellent. It's only 400 yards from the Zoo S Bahn station. They happily stored our bags in locked and ticketed baggage store after checkout until our train at 21:00. All in all, excellent hotel. Not cheap but, great location

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great apart from one thing...”
Reviews.Author: Samuli_1983
Reviews.Content: An Internet connection should have been available 24/7 for free.

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: me_bepa
Reviews.Content: trip all bridges through the spree etc., guided tour throgh the town

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: gaojt
Reviews.Content: birlin is quiet and nice, everything is good. travel is good. ldfoaudofuadoufaodufaudfaiudfoaiudfpiuadpoifupwoeiurqeiourqiewurüqioe.## qoewurqpeuirpqiweurpqwieurüqwuerpq

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MarcelKFCosta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few blocks from the shopping streets and next to the Berlin Zoo. it is easy to get there by train or metro and to get to all major attractions of the city of Berlin. There are also some good night clubs nearby, like Cascade and Maxxim, that you can go walking in about 5 to 10 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: oxonpool
Reviews.Content: It is situated close to a major railway station (Bahnhof Zoo) so is in the perfect position for local and regional rail services as well as local buses. The hotel appears to have been built in the 1970s and, although the public areas have been recently refurbished, some of the bedrooms are looking a little shabby. The rooms themselves are compact: doubles are ideal for one person, but cramped for two. Breakfast consists of a huge buffet with all manner of cereals, fruits, meats, cheeses, hot dishes, fruit juices and hot drinks. Whichever part of the world you come from, there will be something to satisfy you. Service at dinner is polite and fast, but I found the food to be unremarkable. That is not necessarily a criticism of the hotel but is more likely to be a reflection of my taste in food.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: THRYLOS1926
Reviews.Content: modern rooms, nice brekfast, free internet in the lobby,central hotel near main Bus & S,U station

Reviews.Title: “We liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: mariapalatou
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel because it is renovated with a modern disign beautiful friendly staff and good service. Our room was not fully renovated but was clean and spacious enough. No noise. The breakfast was quite satisfied. The restaurant had a very good crowd.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chinese82
Reviews.Content: I have to say we were dissapointed with the standard of the rooms offered. The first recepcionist with whom we checked in was rude and as soon as she gave us our key she dismissed us saying she had other customers. All the other people we spoke to at the recepcion were nice, but this first bad impression was strong. We went t our room and there were renovation works just a couple of doors down and they were drilling so loudly we couldn´t even speak and hear each other voices (really!). We asked to change rooms and the same rude recepcionist told us we were making a big deal out of that, the drilling would stop in half an hour (!). She then gave us another room, and when we went into the bathroom we realised it was stinking of MOLD. Although one couldn´t actually see it because they clearly painted over it (some dark stains remained), it smelled terrible and affected the quality of the air of the whole room. We came downstairs again and finally spoke to another man at the recepcion who was kind and gave us a third room, which was ok, not great, simply ok. I wouldn´t recommend this hotel, and I will most certainly not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stuff and best location for tourits”
Reviews.Author: JosefGol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for eight nights. Located almost at the center of the transportation web in Berlin, less than 5 minutes walk from the Zoologiche Garten. Stuff extremely helpful and cooperative. One problem, the bath tube edge is very slippery and high, so be very careful whenever You leave the bath tube. Wifi too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel for a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RichardClough_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 3 or 4 mins walk from Zoologischer Garten and situated within easy reach of the kurfurstendamm. It was a perfect base for a long weekend in Berlin. It was also easy to get to from Schoneberg Airport. The hotel was clean and modern, exactly what you would expect for Germany. The staff were polite and helpful. We didn't eat in the Bistro, but there was a discount for guests. We preferred to venture out to find real German Fayre, and there was plenty to choose from either locally or a couple of stops on the U-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! DO NOT BOOK! YOU MIGHT END UP IN A DIFFERENT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: areindel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online for my parents, based on its reviews, rate, and location. I called the hotel a few days before the reservation date to confirm, and was assured that everything was in order. When my parents arrived, they were told that their reservation were not actually in the system due to an error (which is impossible given my earlier phone confirmation), and that the hotel was over booked. They had to agree to be transferred to the Holiday Inn (which is under the same ownership), at a much more distant location (and for the same rate). The hotel's position is that under German law they can transfer a guest to another hotel at the same "star rating" anywhere in the same city. Well, this is not what my parents bargained for, and they had to take a long 12-stop subway ride from the Holiday Inn to get to their destination. They were also unhappy with the Holiday Inn by the way. I will never book this hotel again and warn all readers to avoid it - you just don't know where you'll end up! It seems pretty clear from this experience that the hotel's practice is to overbook guests during busy periods and transfer the overflow to another hotel in their chain.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mikemcf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on a long weekend break. Upon our arrival the receptionist was friendly and spoke fluent English. The rooms are not large, however it was clean tidy and comfortable. I note some reviews have commented on the dated decor of their rooms, we stayed on the 6th floor and our room was fine, certainly not an issue as far as I was concerned. The facilities at the hotel were fine and a good nights sleep was easily obtained. We did not eat at the hotel, preferring to choose some local cafes to try varied foodstyles. The hotel is located not too far from the Zoo and a few minutes walk from the train station meaning excellent links to the rest of Berlin. The receptionists were willing to provide some local knowledge about whatever I asked and assisted in advising on the best routes to some of the sites. I would say that if you liked spending time within your room watching the TV then this hotel copuld be expensive as they charge for viewing most things, their wifi is also expensive. . . However it made a great base for exploring Berlin and no complaints from me, recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Very Professional”
Reviews.Author: rogister19
Reviews.Content: The staff from housekeeping, front desk to the restaurant staf were very friendly and professional. Especially their Front Desk Manager who helped me locate a doctor and pharmacy as I had fallen ill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - does the job”
Reviews.Author: MissAtlas
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpful staff. Rooms were small and very dated not luxurious but adequate for a short stay if you are out sighseeing anyway. Breakfast buffet was full of intrnational options and always very busy and chaotic but if you go at the end much more relaxed and enjoyable. Downstairs bar is great though and great atmosphere with some very good wines and wasabi nuts :) rubbish hairdryer in bathroom so take your own if you don't want to spend ages drying your hair. Only liquid soap in bathroom so take your own toiletries .tv is great loads of channels.

Reviews.Title: “Stonking hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Kam_n_Sally
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Excelsior was certainly one of the most memorable even though it was a very short stay. Reasons being the efficiency of the amicable staff, the quality of decor (recently refurbished), clean room (large enough although not exactly palacial) with great bathroom, and very good location (couple minutes' walk from Zoologischer Garten) for getting around. It may only be listed as a 4* establishment but it's way better than many 5* places. Rooms are modern and everything works as you'd expect from Germany. There is a lovely lounge area including open fire and super large plasma TV, as well as bar and restaurant. We didn't use try the restaurant but it was often full of customers good indication of quality). We actually arrived ridiculously early for check-in. They did give us a room early but it was a smoking room so we elected to exchange and wait (just had to drag a couple of backpacks around town for a few hours). Checkout was super fast and efficient. Highly recommended and would definitely stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: markhendo81
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room at this hotel. Instead of a double bed we had two single beds pushed together. The room decor was a bit shabby and did not meet the standards that were portrayed in the hall. Location wise however, this hotel is perfect. Really close to the TIerGarten, it has good public transport links and it was easy to negotiate our way around Berlin from this hotel. If you're aware of what to expect it would be worth staying here primarily for the location. However, if you're expecting a four star standard I wouldn't bother. For us, Berlin was such a fantastic city we spent hardly any time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JohanInSweden
Reviews.Content: + Great location close to Kurfurstendammstrasse and Bahnhof Zoo + Nice lobby and welldesigned rooms + Serviceminded staff - Closed neighbourhood at night

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Not four star!”
Reviews.Author: lr77777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights between christmas and new year. Hotel lobby is quite impressive however the room leaves less to be desired. Average at best, as if they have threw a bit of ikea at an ageing student house. More importantly be very aware of reception swiping your debit card on check in. My stay was €300 however they 'reserved over' a total anount of €450 on my personal account meaning there was €150 I no longer had access to. More worrying perhaps is that I was told this would be refunded to my card and I am have sent three emails and telephoned once to try to get my money back. Each time to get a conflicting report rendering me now to have to file a fradultent claim with visa. Great location, great incompetence.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: robin1Broadstairs
Reviews.Content: Had a super four night stay over new year. Yes, the rooms are small but clean and well equipped. Yes the beds are on rollers but this is not a worry. Yes restaurant is quite pricey but food is excellent. All hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel facilities are excellent. Location is absolutely ideal and value for moneY terrific. Wonderful impromptu firework display on hotel forecourt to greet the new year

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawthorn65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights recently. My partner and I decided to have a whirlwind tour of Berlin. The location is really the best thing about this hotel but that being said the hotel facilities are perfectly adequate. We upgraded to a superior room but it was still very small. The 'double' bed was in fact two single beds pushed together which was a little irritating. The bathroom was tiny but clean and well appointed. We had a bit of a plumbing problem which the reception staff responded to quickly. Although, I think that they fixed the wrong problem, but anyway, at least they tried. The staff were friendly and the check in process went well. The hotel is a stones throw away from the train and bus station and also very close to good shopping and restaurants. There is also an excellent supermarket 3 mins walk away, if you fancy a bottle of wine not at mini bar prices! We did not eat in the hotel restaurant as we were out and about all of the time but it looked to be very popular with a good atmosphere. All in all I would say that the hotel is absolutely fine as a base for exploring the city. I would not recommend it for a romantic weekend or special occasion purely because the rooms are very small but otherwise an OK spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SuperSigne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in November 2010 on the fourth floor just opposite the staff room(!) The hotel lobby is nice with Mac computers and free internet access in the lobby, beautifully decorated bar + restaurant area - but tiny rooms. We have mixed feeling for this hotel. The loacation is splendid: close to the U-bahn and busses to Tegel airport, with Sauvigny Platz and all the restaurants close by in walking distance - a true asset. But expensive breakfast (EUR 18 per person) and tiny tiny rooms - recently re-decorated but not to the highest of standards. We will still recommend the hotel - use the cafes close by for breakfast - and enjoy the location in wonderful Berlin.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, bit pricey though”
Reviews.Author: Elaine459
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week on holiday. The room, although a 'superior' was very small, the wardrobe not wide enough to take regular sized coathangers, there were some provided but not many. No drawer space at all. Storage for one small case only. Bathroom was very well fitted out. The beds extremely comfortable and the room was cleaned well each day. We didnt eat in the hotel (room only, by choice), but the restaurant was quite full each night. The location is good for travel around the city, either walk to the right to the S/U Bahns at the Zoo Garden or left to the U Bahn at Ernst Reuter Platz. If you get to the street running parallel behind the hotel (Ku'dam & Kant Str), there are lots of shops and restaurants. The only down side regarding the location is that the railway bridge you walk under near the Zoo Bahns is home to the local drop outs (we named it smelly corner), but once passed this everything else is clean and clear. A great trip in all

Reviews.Title: “Great starting point in great Berlin”
Reviews.Author: xof_be
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Berlin. Hotel Excelsior lies on the west side of the city and is a great starting point for your discovery of Berlin. The hotel itself has an attractive reception, bar and restaurant. The rest of the hotel seems to be pretty old and it looks like all rooms and hallways have been renovated. You will notice that in the smaller details. Overall the rooms are very small but tidy. I had a room on the back and wasn't troubled by noise of any kind. I have not eaten breakfast so I can't judge that. I did hear from other guests that breakfast was nice but that there was no fresh fruit. I have used the restaurant once for dinner. The atmosphere and service are good but the menu is very poor. Concerning internet access, I was dissapointed. Once again, cabled access is provided in the room but still people are charged silly amounts of money in order to use it. Same goes with wireless access. Wake up! This is the year 2010! There are four fast internet PCs available for guests in the lobby though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excelsior, is it worth?”
Reviews.Author: elimeiri
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not very good, the room and bathroom were very small and rather neglected, the beds were on wheels and moved from side to side all the time The hotel location was good, very good service, breakfast, medium

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mungbean83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location - only 10mins walk from the station? The lobby was beautiful with attentive receptionists who were happy to help! The breakfast in their restaurant was great, a range to choose from! Since we didn't pre-book it, it was slightly dear, so book before you go! The room was as expected from the pictures on their website! Overall had a pleasant stay in a great city! :)

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauler1980
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. the hotel is classed as a 4 star hotel, the lobby area, bar and restaurant is 4star but the rooms are definately not. quite small rooms but that didn't really bother me. not very clean, marks on the walls, bits on the floor, and not well maintained. there were screw holes in the walls, small parts of tiles missing in the shower and damage marks on the ceiling. there was also a mini fridge in the room which, at night, made an awful lot of noise which kept us awake. apart from that the beds were comfortable and the breakfast was very nice. the hotel is in a good location, 5 mins from the nearest underground stop, train station, shops and restaurants. they just need to re-do the rooms to keep in with the look of the entrance to the hotel. i would recommend this hotel for a short stay as the beds and breakfast are good, but if you are after luxury and expect a 4 star room then don't go to the excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “The best food in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: BriggoHarrogate
Reviews.Content: Eight of us went on a Riviera Travel short break to Berlin and the Excelsior is the hotel they use. It is well positioned to explore this fine city and is well appointed and clean. One or two small problems with lack of facilities in the room were dealt with by the rather miserable male members of staff. However, the restaurant was superb. We eat there the first night, when we were rather tired and found out that, as residents, we got a 40% discount! Sitting in the bar for pre dinner drinks we also got a "buy one get one free" offer up to 8pm. The food was fantastic with a superb choice meaning that everyone found something they liked. Coupled with this, the staff were so efficient and friendly that the evening was a total joy. So good in fact that the restaurant was the only one we considered for the rest of the stay. If you stay at the Excelsior, give it a try before considering anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, nicely located, busy restaurant”
Reviews.Author: peterhollow
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is quite a fancy hotel- fireplace in the lobby, big library, a not so cheap dinner restaurant and so on. The rooms are not as polished as the rest of the hotel and rather have a more young and modern design which is also acceptable. The bath complementaries are great. Distance to S and U trains is 5 minutes which is ideal. the area is quiet, yet central. Not much to see out of the window though. Breakfast too expensive but a nice experience as the room is not your usual boring hotel breakfast room, but an actual, brightly designed resturant. Pay TV, pay internet, but free portals in the lobby. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBabe777
Reviews.Content: This is my first negative review. This hotel was completely unacceptable. EVERY morning I was awoken to the sound of drilling and hammering on the floor above us. We were on the 8th floor, and the manager told us they were repairing the roof.....at 7AM!!!!!!! We spent 7 nights in this hotel and every morning I could hear the extrememly loud clattering of some sort of machine in the staff room next to our room. The door squeaked horribly...imagine metal screetching on metal. Every time I called the front desk only to be told they would take care of it., whoch they did not. On the 6th morning when I was RUDELY wokem up to drilling above my head at 7am, myself and another guest went to the front desk. The manager came up to see what the noise was, heard it and promptly went up to the floor above. His response when he came back: "Just one more nail." Long story short, I demnded and got my room changed for my last night. More complaints: one night coming back to room, we had no towels. Another time, no toilet paper. The chef in the open kitchen was tasting our food and licking his fingers as he prepared the dishes. We even saw him stir the potatoes and then lick the spoon! When I heard his smacking noise one time too many, I complained to the manager and his response: "He must taste the food." My parents were told they too could have their room moved, but to come back at the end of the day and their things would be moved. We come back to hear they do not have any rooms available and their old room is still not made up. Also, the beds are 2 twins pushed together with a very hard mattress. The comforter is cozy, but that is all the niceities I will say. They have remodeled the rooms and cut them in half since when my parents stayed here 5 yeras ago, but even they will never recommend this place to anyone again. Now, I am not a picky hotel guest and have stayed in many Motel 6's which were better. I too will never recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Charlottenburg hotel”
Reviews.Author: awpal
Reviews.Content: This time we stayed in Charlottenburg and we were happily surprised by the neighbourhood of the hotel. It's really close to the Bahnhof Zoo with a lot of U's- and S-bahns, close to shopping at KuDamm, the Berlin Zoo and a lot of restaurants at Savigny Platz, and of course the possibility to take a walk in Tiergarten. The room was newly renovated and was very fresh. Last time we stayed at Radisson Blu at Karl Liebknecht Strasse and there was definitely a difference between 5 star Radisson and 4 star Excelsior, but we got a good rate at Excelsior and we enjoyed our stay. I would not recommend the hotel restaurant Franke though, and only because of the poor service, not for the food.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - Not awful”
Reviews.Author: hmfcdoug
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions of this hotel as you go on are fabulous, lovely reception area, nice looking restaurant and lounge area. However the hotel above the ground floor is a little dated in terms of the corridors, etc, although not badly. The superior double room I was in was modern and a decent space, however the bathroom was tiny, hardly any space in it at all. No breakfast or Wi-Fi on offer which is disappointing for a 4 star hotel, although there is free internet access in the lounge area. The huge advantage of this hotel is the location, its brilliant, easy access to train, tube and bus and there is plenty in the area to keep you occupied. I would go back to the hotel if the price was right, however I wouldnt pay over the odds for it as you will easily find better hotels for less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gardrh
Reviews.Content: The location of the Excelsior Hotel is great, it's a five minute walk from Zoo Garten Bahnhof, which connects you with the whole city, Kurfürstendamm is just an additional 3 min walk. Eventhough the location is so near the city the Hardenburger strasse which it is in is a very quiet and peaceful street. The personel was kind and helpful and their english was good, not something that goes for the whole of Berlin. The beds are fantastic, I've never had such a hard time getting out of bed. And that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great city”
Reviews.Author: leahgirlCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to the Zoo station and therefore most conveneint for the trains and buses. Also perfect to take the X9 bus directly to Tegel airport takes hardly 25 minutes. Good hotel, good rooms and good staff. Just stayed for a night so did not have a chance to sample the restaurant and bars even though they looked quite buzzing. Also very close to a supermarket to pick up snacks, beers etc and restaurants and shopping if so inclined. Tour buses and the great sightseeing public trasnport bus no 200 and 100 leave from a short distance.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: shaild
Reviews.Content: not a very good place to go. room was small.moreover bathroom amenities were dismal.had to call plumber to fix tub sink.average and overcrowded restaurant. only saving grace is the location.-close to zoo station n shopping area and good indian restaurants are at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and restaurant; the rest is poor.”
Reviews.Author: Sparkle78
Reviews.Content: Upon walking in to the Excelsior and seeing the modern lobby with a cool gas fireplace, big flat screen and swanky restaurant, you are under the immediate impression you are in a cool, first-rate establishment. But besides the standard room being tiny, the problems we encountered were endless. We had a leak late from the ceiling late at night which no one was available to fix. It was supposedly fixed the next day and then the following evening started leaking again. Our safe suddenly didn't work right before we were about to head out to dinner and when we called downstairs to ask for assistance, the attendant at reception barked at me that she was alone with no backup on duty and no one could help me now. Anytime I called down to reception for any reason at all, the phone rang and rang - this place seems to be severely understaffed. The shower also flooded all over the bathroom. Wi-Fi does not come with the room rate and is provided by an outside company - so you can purchase a package in time increments of a half hour using your credit card. However, no sooner than providing my credit card number to the service, the password didn't work. When I called downstairs to get help, I was told Wi-Fi is run by this outside company and there's nothing the hotel could do - they suggested that I must have used up my allotted Wi-Fi time I purchased and that's why it didn't work. (What??? I'm not an idiot.) There just didn't seem to be anyone in charge. The walls are also paper thin and when attempting to nap in the afternoon we could hear every word spoken next door. On the plus side, the hotel is in a safe area of West Berlin and a 5 minute walk from a main subway station, so if you can't stay in East Berlin (preferable), the location is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Berlin,Comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: roddyrhino
Reviews.Content: 4 nights self arranged city break in Berlin. Hotel rooms were clean and comfortable and with a pleasant outlook. Convenient to travel links for the city ,sights,shopping and airport. Worthy of a mention.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: bgls3000
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews in Trip Advisor before I booked this, and these reveiws were good, mostly citing the need for an interior design makeover. But when I arrived, I was very pleasantly surprised with the understated, sleek design and interior decor. The central chimney and fireplace was ablaze and the lobby was large, open, and beautiful.
