The front desk was quite busy but instantly another staff member was at hand to help me check in - earlier than I had thought I was allowed to. This presented no problem. I needed a mobile phone charger and this too was supplied with ease. The staff were friendly and efficient. My room was immaculate. The bathroom perfectly sized, with quality soaps and beauty products. No minibar, but there were ta/coffee making facilities and fruit juice/water in the room. I would highly reccomend this place. Central, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Compared to 2 years ago”
Reviews.Author: PraslinRep
Reviews.Content: Every year I stay at Excelsior during ITB. Very nicely located and pleasant staff always but they should make more efforts to notice regular repeaters. This year they have renovated the rooms and public area. The rooms are a lot better especially the bathroom amenities. However you can still hear every noise in the corridor or from the room next door which did not bother me much since I was always very tired and slept like a log. The new carpet creates a lot of dust in the room and housekeeping does not do a good job with the daily cleaning. Information about room service was very hard to find. Not enough choices of English Channels available and the position of the screen means you do not have much choices of where to sit in the room to watch TV. Breakfast buffet is great but a bit crowded. Could have had free wi-fi in the room since the free business center only has 4 computers. The grill restaurant needs new decor to match with rest of the hotel and a complete change of menu. Nice lounge and bar for aperitif. I will stay there again since the price is much better than other hotels of same category nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly faded”
Reviews.Author: RJKBrussels
Reviews.Content: Pleasant enough for a business trip, well located near Zoo station. Rooms are large and functional, but rather jaded - sums up the hotel really! Cosy bar area for late drinks and pleasant buffet breakfast (but rather crowded).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but oh so badly dated and in need of decoration”
Reviews.Author: golfrunner800
Reviews.Content: Yes it is good value for the location and even the lobby and check-in are fine in a 1960's or 1970's sort of way but the rooms are very dated and pretty basic with quite grubby paintwork. Otherwise cleanliness is fine. In all honesty, this is a missed opportunity because the staff are excellent but this hotel is long overdue a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Bit dated but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nash0819
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights for a conference running at the Messe. The location was perfect as I was able to catch the S-Bahn to Messe Sud each morning from the Zoo station. And you can take S/U-Bahns from the Zoo station to the livelier eastern side of the City if you want. The hotel looks a bit stern from the outside and is quite old-fashioned inside. The single room was small and very dated, like something out of a 70's TV programme with all the oak veneer and strange heating devices I didn't really get the hang of. The "safe" was actually a lockable box, the key had to be signed out from reception - for free thankfully, The bathroom didn't seem to have any extractor, or leastwise not a working one, so smells tended to linger a little and I did regret the day I had three bratwursts. That said, the bed was comfortable and everything was clean. I didn't hear too much noise from my neighbours, only a TV one night. I was probably lucky however, The cleaner was very keen and insisted on knocking on my door on two separate morning even though I had the do not disturb sign outside. One of the main reasons I chose the hotel was that breakfast was included in the rate and the best part of my stay was the excellent breakfast. Proper hot food with eggs cooked how you wanted them, a wide choice of other food and even free newspapers although the only English language one was the Wall Street Journal. Front desk service was good and when I asked for a taxi on my last morning, there was one there ready to go. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travelers who can't afford luxury but need basic comfort and a convenient location. I would consider going back for business but not for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shopaholickk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Berlin earlier this year in Febuary. This hotel is at a great location- near the train station, shopping district, synagogue, zoo and many places to eat. The room was pretty cosy and clean, simply furnished (the bed was harderthan I'd have liked so I couldn't sleep well, but I guess thats personal preference)- but i dont think its worth the 4 stars they claim. We didn't eat at either of the resturants because we flet it was pretty overpriced as we could get food nearby much cheaper. The staff were wonderfully helpful and polite. One of them even helped us google a resturant we were looking for. The only thing I really really didn't like about this hotel was the walls were paper thin......We could hear the people next door watching tv and having sex!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Joe835
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior Hotel for 4 nights in December and had a great time. It was our first trip to Berlin and I made the rookie mistake of taking a taxi from Schonefeld. This is a BAD idea - the hotel website says a taxi from Tegel is €15 or so but it's twice that from Schonefeld so take the train if you can. It's only €2.80 and the Zoo station is very close to the hotel. Most of west Berlin's attractions are close to the hotel, in fact. Because we were there in December, there was a Christmas market within 10 minutes' walk of the hotel at the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church (which is preserved in its bombed-out state). We were also close to the Ku'damm, the Zoo, a cinema and many cafes and bars. We took a walk to Savignyplatz twice as there's a few nice, simple Italian restaurants in the corner near the S-Bahn station. A pretty good walking tour of Berlin starts at the McDonald's near the Zoo station, that was well worth it if you have 4 hours to spare. And as for the hotel, it was great. The only minus point I'd take from it was the lack of internet facilities. I'm sorry, but I would take free wi-fi as a given these days, yet the Excelsior persists (as does most of Germany by the looks of it) with a pay as you go service that equated to around €20 a day. There was an ethernet wire next to the TV but it wouldn't work and reception, who in fairness sent someone up to investigate, said that the server was offline and would be back in an hour. That was day 2 and it never worked for our whole time there. It was a pity, because in other hotels we've stayed in, we use the net to look up things to do and make bookings. As a result of this lack of internet (I refuse to pay for it, it was extortionate in any case), I was always on the look-out for somewhere to go online and it really was a pain. Even the PC beside reception cost the same to use the internet, it's like they're determined to get paid for what's normally a free service. Leaving that aside, the hotel is great. The room was roomy and clean, the bathroom spacious, the TV, while laborious to get to any channels, was fine. We'd asked for a double and got a twin with two beds pushed together but they were fine. Breakfast was included and was a pretty good buffet, especially their selection of bread. The newspapers at the entrance to the buffet looked complimentary and there was no sign up to suggest there was a charge, until we saw the bill at the end. We also got room service one evening, which was ok. The staff at the Excelsior were fantastic though. They were very helpful, allowing us to check-in at midday. They also have a nice selection of pamphlets etc. with which you can plan excursions etc. It's quite 70's inside but it's well-maintained so I could forgive them for that. All-in-all, I'd go back but I might be tempted to go elsewhere if they had free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a City Break”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located just 5 minutes walk from the Zooligsche Garten S-Bahn (with a supermarket right outside it) and 10 minutes walk from the Ku'Damm. It seemed safe walking around at night. We found the hotel quiet and clean - the decor may not be the most contemporary - but everything we needed was provided. The beds had white duvets on them. The TV had BBC World and CNN english channels. Staff were polite and courteous throughout our stay. The breakfast buffet is served from 0630-1030 and there was plentiful supplies of breads, croissants, yogurts, fruit, cereals, fruit juice, cold meats and cheeses. The hot breakfast is composed of bacon, sausages, scrambled or boiled eggs. There is also a restaurant but we did not eat there or order room service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, ok for a Few days,”
Reviews.Author: cjjste
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is located about a 2 minutes walk to the Zoo Station. If you are coming from the Tegel Airport, take bus 109 and it will take you literally to the front door of the hotel. Found this hotel in a travel package and couldn't resist the price. Cons: Noisy, can hear foot steps and your neighbors. My girlfriend was constantly complaining about privacy issues. Do not use the phone! They charged me a bit for local calling, yes local calling in which I dialed a 800 number using my phone card. Go to a payphone, there are plenty of them at the Zoo Station. Single rooms with one bed is awfully small. The biggest issue is I had was hearing foot steps all night long as the floors are made out of wood, not concrete.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: territastic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior hotel for 3 nights last November, and the location was the best part. It is very close to the Zoologischer Garten station, which linked to the U Bahn and had a direct to Schoenefeld Airport. It is also 5 minutes away from Berlin Zoo (check out the panda!), the KuDamm and Kaiser Wilhelm church. The room was comfy, quite small but we weren't there for much more than sleeping and getting ready. Also watch for the daredevil window cleaners! And if you go to the hotel bar be prepared for it to be quite pricey- although the cocktails were pretty great! All in all a really good hotel which we would definitely go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great rooms and brilliant breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jockkkk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on a fantastic B&B deal, I think about £300 each inc flights. I was really impressed mainly because of the location, a 5 minute walk from Zoologischergarten stations - a main hub which ensured that late nights didn't involve a cab. We were a few mins from a brilliant late night store where you could buy the cheapest beer (we liked a couple at night in our room) and food should you want it. The Kaiser Willem church is there and is beautiful at night as is KaDeWe at Tauentzienstrasse just off the K'Damn. The breakfast was excellent with lots of everything. I like poached eggs so always ask for a couple and these were made every morning for me with a lot of effort made for presentation. The room was a good size and the staff were all ok - I don't remember any problem. Unless I got an amazing 'can't say no' deal elsewhere I'd go back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: mr6
Reviews.Content: THis Hotel is within a 10 min. walk to underground train, food market, and dept store. The area is not bad, but not as good as staying in East Berlin. All the good sites are on the East side. Rooms were clean, but very small. Our air conditioning did not work, so they gave us a room fan. The days we stayed there it was extremely hot, but we had to deal with the fan. The hotel offered breakfast, but it was very overpriced. The only english tv channel was the news. Parking was also very expensive. Internet was not free, they did offer a couple of computers in the lobby for a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Location super!”
Reviews.Author: jland48
Reviews.Content: Location excellent. Hotel is badly in need of renovation. Room small and cramped. Bathroom emitted an odor. No amenties . Hair drier gave out cool air only. Reception personnel not very helpful. Breakfast expensive. Many shops nearby where you could pick up an inexpensive meal.

Reviews.Title: “Food and Atomsphere excellent”
Reviews.Author: Simple01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in the Excelsior and were very impressed with it. On arrival, our check-in was very quick and we were given a superior room even though we booked a standard double room. Room was very clean and spacious but bathroom quite small with no much room to move around. We ate in the restaurant adjoined to the hotel 2 nights and it was very tasty and reasonable. The local beer is very cheap and tasty also!! With regards to day trips, unfortunately, the hotel does not provide tickets for these, only the bus tours of the city which are €14 each for the day. The Zoo is a 5 minute walk from the hotel (to the right as you come out of the hotel). There are beautiful parks to walk around and plenty of museums too. Enjoyed our stay in Berlin and suggest maybe prebooking day trips prior to your visit as very hard to find the ticket outlets for these. Advice.....if travelling to Berlin in the summer months, beware of the wasps, they were everywhere we went....!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel and spotless”
Reviews.Author: Marploug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Excelsior Hotel in Berlin in March this year. We stayed for 4 nights. This was our second trip to Berlin, first to the Excelsior. It is located a couple of minutes from the Zoo S Bahn station and about a 5 minute walk into Kerfurstendamm. The room was spotless and cleaned daily. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this one if you are planning a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Excelsior is a no-frills hotel that is value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ces123456
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal in expedia for this hotel - it came to about $115 (plus taxes) per night (no breakfast) when all the surrounding area hotels were priced much higher. Overall, for the price we got, it was value for money. Pros - Location, location, location! We were so happy with how close Excelsior was to the Zoologischer Garten train station and Kurfurstendamm (shopping street). It is 15 - 20 mins walk to the KaDeWe (famous mall in Berlin). Perfect Location if you don't want to spend time getting a cab or taking the subway. We pretty much walked everywhere. Tour buses are also available around the block (go down Faranstrasse) to take you to the main attractions (Wall, Checkpoint Charlie). Zoo is literally down the street. There are lots of places to eat, and a supermarket down the street to get snacks etc. Walking tours are also available which meet right across from the Zoologisher Garten Station. We spent most of our time outside the hotel so didn't mind they had no pool, gym, spa etc. Staff were attentive, shampoo bottles and soap was missing from our bathroom, we told the concierge and they gave it right away. Towels and bathroom were clean. You would need your room card to scan the switch to use the lights - it was energy efficient and environmentally friendly. We didn't eat breakfast or have meals in the hotel. Walk along Kurfurstendamm and you'll find tons of places to eat. I suggest the Bratwurst Booth that sells the best currywurst in Berlin. Bathroom and towels were clean (no stains) and the shower had a good water pressure. Cons - Room was small. We got a room with a King Size Bed. Usually, other 4-star hotels have a small table and a couple of chairs or a sofa, but this one only came with one chair and a narrown wall table. There was no space where you can take your meal back to your room and eat. It still has that 70's appeal so it is not chic at all, they have a sign saying they are "upgrading" the hotel on the front desk but I didn't really see any construction going on. They do need some kind of make-over to really call themselves a 4-star. There are scratches on the hardwood tables, frame of the bed etc. Even the signs on the hallway and doors look like they were still from the 70's/80's. The hairdryer looked like a vaccum cleaner and was very weak. It took forever to dry my hair. Also, the shower curtain didn't fully cover the entire bath tub, so water would spill everywhere after a shower and get the floor really wet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Wonderful Breakfast..”
Reviews.Author: somerset58
Reviews.Content: We would definately stay at this hotel again when in Berlin.The standard rooms are big enough and the bed was quite large and comfortable. The breakfasts are wonderful with fresh fruits, cereals, meats and even a fry up. Fresh coffee or tea is served at your table and the staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful. The U Bahn and S Bahn stations are just a stroll away so no need for taxis. Its very easy to find you way around Berlin,just catch the No.100 bus from the bus station and you can hop on and off all day, it only costs 6.20 euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Superb with some catches”
Reviews.Author: thetravelmonkeyuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a stone's throw from Zoologischer Garten S-Bahn station. For west Berlin it's in a great location, but not so much if you want to stay in the east. The lobby is a good sign as to the quality of the hotel. Desk staff were very helpful. One morning we woke up and there was a foul smell coming in through the door. We investigated and saw other guests affected. We left it while we went out sightseeing but when we came back it was still there. When I spoke to the front desk they immediately upgraded us. Both rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The view wasn't amazing but that wasn't too much of an issue. The washroom was large and was in great condition. Breakfast was superb but was 16 euros per person. We stayed for 9 nights and it cost us only 150 pounds more than staying in a well-known hostel. Not bad value.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth staying there for the location alone.”
Reviews.Author: The_Travel_princess1
Reviews.Content: Before I comment on this hotel it's necessary to explain that I chose this through a last minute website because of its location and I was definitely not disappointed. The location of the hotel is a ten minute walk down the road from the Zoologischer garten station, zoo, shops etc and the bombed church. It's a beautiful area to be around in summery weather. Although I must note the area with the sex shops and supermarket is a bit dodgy at night. The hotel itself had a large space downstairs with expensive computer internet access but free internet if you have a laptop. The corridors were pretty and the bar looked nice though I didn't drink there. The room itself was very average. The bathroom did smell like bleach had never been used- it didn't really bother me but it drove my partner mad. The room wasn't very big, was slightly hot as sunlight came directly into it and the movies were 30 euro for a package which for any Brit is well expensive when you think we could get a 7 quid average deal in UK hotels. The staff were very helpful and friendly and made an effort to show off their English despite my partner and I happily using our German phrase books...lol.. But, going back to the location!! It was so convenient!! You can get to the Tegel airport in 20 minutes by bus and charlottenberg castle is only 10 minutes away on the same bus route. The zoo down the road is excellent; Potsdammer and Alexander platz are easy to get to. At the end of the day, if you get a good price for the rooms then it is worth it for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Flashback into the 70s”
Reviews.Author: magyar_lany
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very dated and cries for a makeover. The housekeeping tries to keep rooms clean despite of age. This was my impression. Location is close to Zoo station, comfrortable for public transport, but also an area full of homeless people which is running down steadily. If you can get a cheap rate it is ok to stay there for 1 or 2 nights. But I wouldn't stay more. Breakfast variety is fine. Very unusual for a 4 star hotel is however that requesting a cappuccino for breakfast makes you to pay for that separately. In the breakfast only coffee, tea and juice is included. Maybe that's an hommage to the 70s when cappuccino wasn't as popular as nowadays. Very strange !! Another service downturn: Breakfast brought to the room costs additional 5 Euro; I havne't experienced such a service charge in other 4 or 5 star hotels in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: AndrewGlasgow
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel in a magnificent location. The staff make your hotel extra special, with nothing being to much for them to do for you. We had a lovely stay in your city it is just beautiful and the hotel has a great location for sightseeing and walking to the wonderful shops. I work in a hotel myself and to be given complimentary upgrades on arrival for our rooms was extra special and the champagne given to me on my birthday was such a nice touch. I will recommend your hotel to anybody going to Berlin and hopefully we will be able to return one day. Once again thanks for a memorable stay. S Aitken

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and liked it. For the price, you get good quality accommodation. It is a few U-bahn and S-bahn stops away from the main sights, and the location near the Zoo station is great for getting the S-bahn or train to Schonefeld airport. The room was clean and large. The bed was also comfortable - however, we had booked a double bed (and had booked a month in advance), and the hotel could only offer to put two twin beds together to make a double bed...although they did offer to put us in a room with a double bed, but it was a smoking room! The heating system in the room also seemed to have a mind of its own - the temperature was ok, but we never managed to raise it more, even by working the temperature console. The bathroom was clean and the shower was powerful. However, there was very little soap/shampoo, and this was not replaced. The tea/coffee we used was also not replaced. The desk staff were very helpful, in one case coming up to our room to personally change a kettle (which had stopped working).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kobyStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: The Berlin excelsior is a great hotel. It is very centrally located and easy to get to. We flew into Berlin Scheonfeld airport and got the tube to zoo gardens station which cost euro 2.90 single. From zoo station it is a 5 minute walk if that. Just come out of the station and walk under the bridge, its a straight road you cant miss it. The rooms were very comfortable and warm which is what we wanted in December. Breakfast was excerllent with lots to choose from. Cooked sausage, egg, hash browns, bacon, rolls, jam, cold meats, cereal, yogurt, fresh juice. The hotel is a short walk from both the S and U Bahn. If you walk out of the hotel down the road about 600 yards there is lots of shops and department stores and a christmas market. There is also a big supermarket outside zoo station which is ideal for getting drinks and snacks from. The hotel is ideally located for visiting the Brandenberg gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Reichstag, Berlin wall walk and many of the other attractions. They are all just a short tube ride away. We brought day passes which meant unlimited travel on the trains which cost euro 5.90 a day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One night in berlin”
Reviews.Author: willandjess
Reviews.Content: Onenight in Berlin, everything we needed. affordable, close to transport and sights! would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PJS210308
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin for the football (England 2 Germany 1, ha ha!) and for a bit of sight seeing. Saw this hotel on the net which was reasonably priced. Having stayed there for 3 nights, I have got say that I was very impressed. Room was spacious and clean. Staff were very attentative, helpful and polite. Breakfast was very good and we had an excellent meal in the in-house restaurant. Location is also very good, 5 minute walk to train / tube and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: felixCrewe
Reviews.Content: Good location,only a few minutes from the u/s bahn station at zoo garden,staff very friendly,breakfast ideal for starting the day,cooked or continental,rooms very tidy, overall would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & good location”
Reviews.Author: travelerww
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is a five minute walk along a wide boulevard from the terminus (Zoologischer Garten) of the X9 tegel airport express bus. The U-Bahn & S-Bahn stations and the very popular free newberlin walking tour start meeting point are also there. The room and bath size was adequate. Furnishings were simple, showing some wear, but overall cleanliness was very apparent. There was a flat screen TV with BBC & CNN channels available. Coffee and Tea bags are provided along with a plug-in hot water pot. At the ground floor three elevators are available and the breakfast buffet restaurant was quite busy. The front desk employees are very friendly and I got some very good tourist information from them. A couple of blocks from the hotel is Savignyplatz (a large plaza) where there are a number of international cafes and restaurants with both inside and outside tables. By european standards, this hotel would be a four star. It appears as such on travelocity and other hotel booking websites. On the hotel's own website I was able to book a single room (with double bed) for 47 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: RuthRamatEfal_Israel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for seven nights at the beginning of October 2008. We arrived very early but received our room immediately (top floor, facing the back garden, very quiet). The room and bathroom were very compact but reasonably furnished. The cleaning service was fine. The breakfasts are outstanding by any standard and we found the staff to be very helpful with info vis-a-vis getting around the city. The hotel itself is centrally situated in the centre of West Berlin, a few minutes walk from the Zoo Railway Station. I would certainly recommend the hotel though we paid quite a high rate because there was a tremendous demand for hotels rooms during October.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, very tired.”
Reviews.Author: travelled_from_TO
Reviews.Content: Tired, very tired. This hotel has seen better days and with some effort it could see them again. The location is central and easy to get to. To bad those who own it don't seem to care. And, most annoying - the lack of wifi service, except for a ridiculous fee, is most annoying.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: paddywackaris
Reviews.Content: very pleased with this hotel good location and lovely and clean breakfasts were excellent i would have no hesitation in recommending it did'nt think much of berlin all concrete ,steel and glass. very disappointing all the wonderful old buildings were destroyed in the war

Reviews.Title: “Would return...good value...”
Reviews.Author: seamusgw
Reviews.Content: spent 5 days at the Hotel Excelsior..... would recommend it ......very good value for what we got c.€76 per room per night including breakfast...booked on-line... would return for the convenience and value great location, walking distance to Zoo station where all transport links are located and tour buses and walks depart.....walking distance to main shopping are around Kudam.... we had two sizable single rooms with twin beds and clean spacious bathroom with bath and shower.... buffet breakfast was excellent with a wide range of fruit, juices, yoghurt, breads, cold meat , cheeses, cakes tea , coffee etc...eat as much as you like...breakfast time can be very busy especially when tour bus parties are staying on the down side......hotel looks unattractive on outside…rooms could do with updating and corridors are dark and dreary.....some staff were very helpful....most efficient and functional....weather was very warm and air conditioning in my room had limited effect but windows could be opened...… however beds were very clean, comfortable and room fully cleaned every day…kettle in room... bar area off foyer is small and dull ...better going out to a neighbouring cafe Eating out near the Hotel would recommend Cafe Hardenberg 5 mins walk to the left of the Hotel exit for good tasty cheap food especially large filling salads... area behind hotel around Savingy platz c. 10 mins walk has a good choice of restaurants especially the Greek one; Very good authentic italian off Kudam..... Ristorante Arlecchino on Meinekestrassee Recommend Insider Tours guided trips, leave from MacDonalds in front of Zoo c. 10 am....best way to see Sacksenhausen and Potsdam in a day is on a guided trip...trips are good value Overall would return to Hotel Excelsior because of location and the breakfasts...Berlin is a cheaper city than most other western capitals and a great place to visit

Reviews.Title: “loved the excelsior”
Reviews.Author: judychamer
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed staying here the location is perfect for tourists loads to see and easy access to tour bus -a must do and also the boat trip on the spree ask the hotel for the start point up stream its far better and comes back via acanel route so you see different things[taxi to start point 12 euros] rooms comfortable staff very helpfull and friendly breakfast very good bar area very comfortable with excellant staff hotel clean and homely stayed at the park berlin this year and it isnt a patch on the excellsior --[see seperate review]

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: poloEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Excelsior for 3 nights 8-11th April. Good check in and we were allowed to store luggage as room was not ready due to very early flight. Room a little small and rather dated and bathroom also very tiny but both kept very clean. Breakfast as stated by other reviews very good with plenty of choice. Bar prices rather expensive and it is advisable to find other bars close by of which there are many. The Europa Centre 10mins walk away has nice restaurants. The Bavarian and also the Allegro were 2 which we tried and found to be very acceptable. The hotel is very central and a good choice if the Ku'damn is where you wish to shop. The beautiful departmental store is only about 15 mins away and the food dept on 6th floor is a must. Tour bus is a good way to see the sights as you can hop on and off and starting point is close by. The hotel is a good choice if you wish to be central, but not if decor is a priority as the hotel is rather tired looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bit souless”
Reviews.Author: kevwest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February. Great location , very close to the Zoo station - 35 mins away from Schonenfield airport - and with a bus station two mins away. Double room was clean , with good heating and a window that opened - rare sometimes. Cleaned thoroughly each morning - usually while we were at breakfast - which was very good , masses of choice , although the fry-up could have been hotter. Small bar in the foyer area , pricey and not much atmosphere. Tv in room has 25 channels , but the only English language ones were CNN and BBC World , so not the best. Short walk to the Kudamn , and found some nice resturants ( The Piazza and Patricio's) and bars in the Savagny area just 2 streets from hotel. Take the 100 or 200 bus from across the road to hotel and you'll see all the sights. Although there was a kettle in the room , only 2 tea bags and creamers - but supermarket close to the station helped us out , also sold Bratwurst/Brockwurst for 1euro each. No toileteries in bathroom -so suprmarket came in doubly handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a little worn down”
Reviews.Author: BenganJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Berlin Excelsior from February 14 to February 17. It has a perfect location on a quiet street just a couple of hundred meters from Bahnhof Zoo and Kurfürstendam. The hotel is a little worn down but kept very clean. We had booked superior rooms and these were quite large although the bathroom was rather small. Breakfast was very busy but the hotel managed this nicely by opening the restaurant for breakfast and also a conference room close to the restaurant to make room for everyone. Breakfast was really good and up to the high German standards for breakfast. Prices in the bar was a little high with €5 for a normal beer and €9 for a drink. But instead of visiting the hotel bar go outside the hotel and go for instance to Café Hardeberger on the same street (a couple of hundred meters towards Ernst Reuter platz - the opposite direction of Bahnhof Zoo). Here you can get a beer for €2.50 and a meal for €3 and up. There is also a coffee shop (Balzac) between the hotel and Café Hardeberger. If you want to have something to eat in your room go to the supermarket inside Bahnhof Zoo it doesn't look much on the outside but its quite large on the inside. To go to the hotel we took the bus from Tegel airport (line X9) to Bahnhof Zoo for €2.10 per person, it took about 15 minutes and the bus runs every 10 minutes on weekdays. Going back we took a taxi which costed €17 including tip on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Escape99
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent breakfast, staff friendly, rooms a little tired but fine. Comfortable beds and clean. Would recommned and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Busy breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Junkroom
Reviews.Content: Having read the wide variety of opinions on this hotel, we were not sure what to expect. First of all, the location is excellent, so close to Bahnhof Zoo and all travel connections and a short stroll from really good cafes, restaurants and shops. The hotel was certainly busy, especially when tour groups were in, and the staff were under pressure then, but were normally helpful and friendly. Breakfast, although it ran from 6.30 to 10.30, was very busy indeed between 8 and 9, often involving a wait for a table (though it was a very good breakfast and well worth waitng for). The public areas were perfectly acceptable but very busy at certain times. The universal smoking is more than a bit off-putting, but that is not the hotel's fault. If you can choose your times for checking in and out, for taking breakfast and for requesting information, you should have no problems. The rooms were fine; I can see what some other commentators mean when they say that refurbishment is needed, but they were clean, well serviced and appropriately provided. If you're fussy about decor you might find reason to demur. We were in one of the rooms at the rear of the building, and experienced no noise problems of any kind. I would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot complain!”
Reviews.Author: Caractacus2012
Reviews.Content: I picked The Berlin Excelsior as part of an EasyJet deal and was suspiscous as the overall package price was very cheap. There was no need for doubt as the hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is very handy for the Zoo Station, the main shopping street and Tiergarten, the massive park. The hotel room was clean, tidy and warm - very welcome as the temperature was starting to drop when we arrived. The best thing I could say was that it was very quiet, not a peep from the neighbouring room or hallway. Breakfast was impressive, a large buffet with every requirement catered for. The only gripe is the cold nature of the counter staff who, though never rude, did not convey any warmth. That's excusable if you're to believe the stereotypes of Germans but we encountered much more welcoming service in the shops & restaurants in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lombear
Reviews.Content: This is not what I would say was a 4 star hotel, more of a 3 star. The room was okay however dated, the bathroom was clean but had years of dirt ground in and needs updating. The room was okay although the previous guests socks remained which didn't leave much confidence in the cleaning. We had breakfast included with our stay. The food was good however if you arrive at the restauarnt late within the breakfast time you will find it difficult to find a clear table and we had to ask the waitress to clean a table for us, and it wasn't busy when we arrived! The location of the hotel was good just a 5 minute walk to the trains station (near the zoo). And there are a number of restaurants (opposite direction along the road to the zoo) nearby which are very nice. Would I stay hear again....maybe but only as a last option. Don't get me wrong this was not a bad hotel I just feel we expected a lot more for price and a hotel that is rated as being 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “a bit kitschy & old fashioned but very convenient/central”
Reviews.Author: alfa-red
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in need of re decorating but in fairness due to the convenience of its location and what you get for the price it is good value. the breakfast is extensive and quite good although it can be hard to find a table at the busy periods which is a little annoying. the store house grill food is very good and serves until quite late (handy if you get in late with a hunger). excellent staff in the storehouse grill -very friendly but not OTT. service a little slow but food very good quality. Our room was smoke stained and smelt musty, reception staff could not meet our requests to change to a non smoking room. the hotel is very conveniently located and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Deejaysee
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin through a tour operator which uses the Excelsior. No complaints really - pleasant enough and located near to the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church and the Ku'damm, and many restaurants in the vicinity. You can buy tickets for the S bahn and U bahn (just five minutes walk away), from reception and the sightseeing buses stop outside. Room was clean albeit slightly dated, and breakfast was reasonably good. I found the staff to be friendly and attentive. One can easily spend a week in Berlin - so much to see, and I want to go back to visit places I didn't have time for on this occasion. As I have said, the hotel is fine, but it is a typical tourist/business bland affair as you would find in any city, so next time I shall be looking for a hotel with more character, and located further east.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NigelO
Reviews.Content: We paid extra to have a superior room, and we were disappointed. The space was about 21 ft by 11 ft with a large comfortable bed, but the only other furniture was a couple of hard armchairs and a low table. The air-conditioning was one of those portable units that you have to put water in; it wasn't working and although we asked for it to be repaired, nothing happened. Decor is drab 1970's mahogany. Breakfast was chaotic -- most days they were overwhelmed with coach parties and you were bounced into an unsuitable small room; you ended up clearing the table yourself. We sat in the bar for ages and the waiter wandered round gossiping with his colleagues, but never came to serve us. Plenty of good eateries around; try the bistro on the corner (turn left out of the front door) or several in Uhland Str 15 mins walk. But the Excelsior was too much money for a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is like the Curate's Egg - good in parts.”
Reviews.Author: Gerry1934
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent. Close to train & bus stations, as well as a range of restaurants. Breakfast: Very good Cleanliness: Very clean Decor: Dated but totally acceptable Air Conditioning: In our room (621) I had to stand on a chair to reach the controls. The system was efficient but too noisy to have on at night - so we were quite uncomfortable. General Comment: It is like city-centre transit hotels throughout Europe, but I would rate it 'Low 3 Star' (not 4 Star) because many 'little things' (e.g. face cloths in bathrooms and tea cups at breakfast) are not provided. ACID TEST: Would we stay in this hotel again? YES, but not in the summer (air con) and only if the price was right (e.g. 2 or 3 Star rates)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 08Val
Reviews.Content: Hotel about 5 mins walk from Zoo station where you can access the underground, the S bahn, Buses and regional trains. Get a 48 hour or 72 hour ticket which covers all trains and is excellent value for money. Hotel staff very helpful and all spoke english. They recommended 2 excellent restaurants close by Rotosand (Fish) and Maredo (Steaks) both about 15 mins walk from hotel. The hotel rooms are a bit smaller that usual but adequate with excellent storage. Breakfast was a hot and cold buffet with a good selection which included bacon and eggs, fresh fruit, cold meats and cheese etc. I would no hesitation recommending this hotel. 5 mins walk to the Ku Damm which is an excellent shopping street. If you fly into Schoenefeld airport a five minute walk will take you to the regional train which costs 2.10 and takes you to the Zoo station, taxi costs 35 euro

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonTLondon
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and in a good location, about 5 minutes walk to the zoo station. The breakfast was really nice with lots of food to choose from and there were tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The staff and management were always very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again when we next visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “100% HAPPY with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: glendower
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week for 2 nights and we were all 100% pleased with this hotel. This is the 1st hotel that we can't give any negative comments, everything i.e.location is very central, less than 5 minutes walk from Zoo station, breakfast was absolutely delicious and plenty of choices, one can put on a few pounds after breakfast , staff were friendly, room was clean & quiet and surprise surprise, there was a kettle for making tea/coffe in the room. We absolutely love this hotel and don't understand why some gave negative comments. Our advice to others who plan to stay in Berlin for holiday, Excelsior Hotel is definately the choice. We will definately come back to this hotel in our next trip to Berlin. Welldone Hotel Excelsior!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsDavies
Reviews.Content: A really enjoiyable stay. The staff were helpful and friendly, the room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was exceptional, self service with plenty of choice. We were close to the rail and underground stations, and across the road from the Zoo (which was the best we had been to!) We ate in the hotel most nights and the food was very good and surprisingly inexpensive. The best thing of all were the tea and coffee facilities in the room - a rare find in a European hotel. Being January we also got a great deal on the price! Would defintely return.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Teithiwr9
Reviews.Content: Period of stay: December 3rd - 7th, 2006. This was an excellent choice of hotel. It is so near the main Zoo station for most trains and city buses and the main city transport office for tickets and information was most convenient - all literally a few yards down Hardenbergstrasse. We could not fault any aspect of the accommodation - the room was regularly cleaned, the furniture and room / bathroom facilities were in perfect condition and it was such a welcome to find tea/coffee facilities - relatively unusual in many European hotels outside Britain!! The self-service breakfast was of a very high standard with adequate choice of menu and efficiently staffed. There was a quality restaurant for other meals in the hotel at a reasonable price and also a choice of other restaurants nearby and a supermarket for essentials. All reception staff were most helpful and accommodating. This hotel we would use again and strongly recommend for its high standard (at a reasonable price), its efficient staff and its convenient location which contributed to our enjoyable stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3* but very good value”
Reviews.Author: MonikaB
Reviews.Content: Advertised and classed as a 4* hotel, the reality is a little different. Very 70's decor that could do with refurbishing and small rooms with basic amenities. Breakfast is like an assualt course as it is very busy and there are too few tables for the number of guests booked in. I ended up taking breakfast back to the room but some of my friends found it so tiresome that ,despite breakfast being included in our rate, they elected to buy breakfast in a local cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard of hotel”
Reviews.Author: OOPIM04
Reviews.Content: central location clean and tidy a good base for touring around berlin .food good easy location to find from zooalagical gardens do not get to hung up about bad reviews (most where during world cup)

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: crushdummy
Reviews.Content: Location is good - only a 5 minute walk to the Zoo S and U bahn stations and the starting point for the X9 and 109 buses to Tegel. The trip to Tegel on the X9 bus is about 15 minutes while the 109 takes about 20 minutes. The 100 and 200 buses that run east-west through Berlin start and end here. Rooms facing the back of the hotel are very quiet whereas the ones at the front face a noisy, busy street. We had a problem with the air conditioning in our room and had to keep the small window open. Luckily, our room was in the back, it was September and the weather was cool. The room was well decorated and clean but very small for a four star hotel. The closet was also very small and hard to use. The condition of the hotel was very good. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a good selection of items. Although the Excelsior has a restaurant, we found a number of more interesting ones in the area behind the hotel around Savigny platz. Most residents appeared to be business or independent travelers. Only one small tour group was observed. Staff was very helpful at a very early checkout and brought us juice and coffee from the closed breakfast room. Although we had no serious problems at the hotel, we would choose a different hotel next time. We only stayed at the hotel for 2 days and could live with the small room. A longer stay would be less pleasant and very cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: CaliSwissMiss
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Excelsior Hotel is well located near the Zoo rail & metro station and it is a good home base for touring the city. It is basic, clean and safe. It is your standard big hotel and lacks any charm, but we didn't spend a lot of time here, so it was fine for us. It was a good value at about 100 Euros a night. We stayed during the first weekend of the World Cup and despite it being very busy, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Don't book groups at Berlin Excelsior Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beerchen
Reviews.Content: Old, oldfashioned, busy, noisy, unfriendly, grubby, not accommodating and not at all fair! I advise tour operators not to book this hotel, except for easily satisfied groups!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tourist100
Reviews.Content: I was really concerned about this hotel after reading some of the previous reviews, however my fears were unfounded and we found it an excellent base for touring Berlin. The staff were all incredibly helpful and friendly, check in and check out were a piece of cake, the breakfast was really good. The room was smallish but clean and with air conditioning that worked all night, the beds were comfortable. The bathroom could have done with a refurbishment but was clean and adequate + masses of hot water. I wouldnt class it as a 4* but it was a great base at under £50 per room + breakfast for 2. Re the location, dont be put off by the punks/drunks around the railway bridge. I was travelling with my young teen daughter and we found that they just keep themselves to themselves even at 11.30pm. An Added factor to reassure other travellers - just passed the railway bridge there is an American institute that has an armed German police guard on the pavement 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Good all-round value”
Reviews.Author: wolfreton
Reviews.Content: Expedia got my group of four a good deal. The hotel is in a very good position. Rooms were good breakfast very good staff very good. There is no downside here. I have read some poor reviews for the Excelsior and in our opinion it doesn`t deserve them..... we have stayed often in Berlin at 3 star places and they have been a long way off the Excelsior .

HotelInfo.Name: Berlin Excelsior Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hardenbergstrasse 14, 10623 Berlin, Germany
